stories.title: Red Flags to Look Out for When Joining a Data Team

stories.text:
Hey all, I'm cofounder of a startup in the Kubernetes space with a major open source offering (robusta.dev). I need a way to track reach + community engagement on social media.

Our community is on fire and people are writing blog posts and doing review videos about us. But I don't have a single graph right now that tracks this. We already raised our seed round but we're getting questions from major VCs today about the growing community. It's important we have something numeric that we can track and show for the A round.

Any recommendations for tools to track this?

edit: to be more specific, we'd like to track LinkedIn, Twitter, Slack statistics, social media mentions, YouTube views, and GitHub engagement. Open to more ideas for what we should track too. We do not need to track specific users - we just need the overall statistics.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you monitor social media and community engagement?
Install Xubuntu 20.04, 21.10, or 22.04 on Raspberry Pi 4

stories.text:
As a Linux DE where the project expresses its intention to replicate MacOS verbatim (cleanly) - excluding Apple branding, imagery, fonts, etc.

Would they win the lawsuit?

Given it would be open source, would they sue each member of the project individually?

What if each member is in different countries - would they need to be tried in a US court?

I have heard of "trade dress" being applied to certain items, would it apply to software?

Apple are suing Samsung over the lockscreen of Samsung phones, is there a precedent here?
stories.title: Ask HN: Can Apple sue an OS project replicating macOS's “look and feel”?
An Economy of Suffering - Non-essential, naked work
Google: Demotion of Websites That Receive a Large Volume of Notices [pdf]
